title: (x) Looking for a typeface with a round/circular C like - various {gang}
content:
I'm looking for a typeface with a round/circular C like that of Century Gothic:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140328103406im_/http:/typophile.com/files/circlec_4194.gif)

However, I find the lowercase for Century Gothic quite nasty. What are my alternatives?

Thanks!
author: mllecait

comments.content: Gotham and Proxima Nova, for starters. Or Avant Garde and Futura. Or Kabel.

Do you really find it nasty? I guess it can look a bit strange due to the slight extended/lopsided feel it has.

I was at the snow over Christmas and I saw this sign quite a bit. I really despise the FHWA Standard Typeface, but used here it looks awesome, and the C is very circular without giving the modernist or Futura-esque feel.

I believe it is FHWA Standard Series E.

(Sorry for the iStockphoto, haha)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140328103406im_/http:/typophile.com/files/1_6094.jpg)

Thanks for the start.  
I guess "nasty" isn't a good word -- maybe it's just too "young." To me Century Gothic evokes childrens books and so on... not exactly what I'm going for.

Something a bit more modern than some mentioned above could be Adrian Frutiger's [Avenir](http://web.archive.org/web/20140328103406/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/avenir/), or Avenir Next (I know they have differences, but I think most of the 'Next' font improvements are too subtle for me, especially at normal sizes, as a general observation of this recent Linotype genre).

- Mike Yanega
Consider also the light-to-middle weights of [FF Super Grotesk](http://web.archive.org/web/20140328103406/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_super_grotesk/)
